name: Holiday Inn Express Coon Rapids

reviews.text: Great hotel. I have stayed here many times in the past and the staff has always been great - with the newly completed renovation this hotel cannot be beat. The new beds are the best and their new bedding is fantastic - every item is washable - no more bedspread. They really did a tremendous job on their renovation.
reviews.title: Newly renovated and great staff

likes.liked: — The Staff is the BEST! Great Service!

reviews.title: Had nightmares about it
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel with our 2 kids ages 8 and 2 for an extended stay. We had to be in the hotel for 3 weeks during our relocation to MN while we waiting on our house closing. The hotel lobby and the rooms have a stale smoky odor to it. We booked a suite as we were staying so long which the size was pretty good. The main problem I had was the housekeeping staff. On our first day there one of them asked if the staff should only come by once a week to clean up the room. When I said no there are 4 of us living in a small space she gave me an attitude. After that there would be dust all over the furniture and they generally just did a bad job. We are used to Marriott hotels and maybe we just got used to there housekeeping staff.

Booked for a large group for a soccer tournament. It was kinda tough for some of the partrons but I had a great time. The mall isn't really anything to talk about as it seems small and was under construction. Several restaurants within a mile or two, pool my kids enjoyed, the girl working the front desk was an idiot (but didn't bother me any because I didn't need anything special from her), the cinnamon rolls in the morning were amazing, hotel was easy enough to get to, I'd stay again with a good rate.
reviews.title: GREAT cinnmon rolls, decent room, bad staff

reviews.text: On booking this hotel I requested nonsmoking room and was not notified by the booking agent that there were no nonsmoking rooms available. When I arrived I was told they had not had any nonsmoking rooms available for the past week even though I had made reservation with their desk clerk the day before. I was given a smoking room that reeked of cigarettes and no compensation from them for not delivering the product they promised me (a nonsmoking room). They did attempt to find me a nonsmoking room in the area but the closest they could find was more than 20miles away in the wrong direction. I did stay there and went home smelling of cigerette smoke.
reviews.title: smoker's paradise
A slow remodel project is underway
reviews.text: Rather than closing to remodel, this hotel seems to have decided to "touch up" one room at a time. The common areas are in desperate need of an overhaul, starting with the 70's wall paper that is plastered on every wall.

Work is being done on this property, and I wish I would have stayed at the Fairfied Inn that is less than 1/2 mile away (so close but yet so far). Choices in the area are slim and my colleague seems to have made the wrong one.
reviews.title: a great place for business travel

reviews.text: The staff is very nice, and I feel bad that they have to work in such a "dreary" atmosphere.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: a nice clean, comfortable hotel in the northern Twin Cities suburbs. I spent about 20 nights a year here for a song. (I have a local rate) Local dining options are not the best and the roads nearby are a bit confusing but every stay i have had here in the last 3 years was excellent.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay here, the room was clean, the bed was comfy. Had a problem in that my TV was very staticy but I called the desk and the guy tried to fix it right away. No luck but he did offer to change my room. I decided to just stay where I was b/c I was I had unpacked and I was tired. The fitness center was adequate but was close to 80 degrees and the AC seemed to be out of service. The pool area was small but looked decent. Breakfast was good and well stocked. Staff was friednly and helpful. I'd stay again.
reviews.title: OK to Good Hotel

aka: Holiday Inn Express Coon Rapids Hotel Coon Rapids
description: The Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Coon Rapids is located just minutes from The National Sports Center in Blaine, Northtown Mall, and many fine restaurants and shopping centers.Upon entering the hotel you will be warmly welcomed by our friendly staff and newly renovated interior. We also offer free hot breakfast with our trademark cinnamon rolls. Enjoy our newly remodeled and spacious guest rooms. Sleep in comfort on our new plush beds featuring the Simply Smart Bedding line. All guest rooms are equipped with wireless high-speed Internet access, a microwave, refrigerator, iron/ironing board, hairdryer, coffee maker, 2 phone lines and voice mail. We offer a variety of room types, including two queen beds, one king bed, king-size with a Jacuzzi, extended stay suites with a full kitchen, handicap accessible rooms and parlor suites with a separate bedroom. All guest bathrooms feature the exclusive Stay Smart shower head by Kohler and larger, more plush towels. All our rooms have 25-inch TVs with in-room movies, remote and cable including HBO. We have an indoor pool, whirlpool, fitness center, guest laundry facilities, valet laundry and business services. Our hotel is located on the corner of Springbrook Drive and Coon Rapids Blvd just one mile from the 610 Bridge and only 15 minutes from downtown Minneapolis. Accept our invitation and make your future reservation at the Holiday Inn Express Coon Rapids. We can't wait to see you!
